Key Match Events: In a historic victory, Ireland secured their maiden win in men’s T20Is against Pakistan in the series’ inaugural clash, largely attributed to former Ireland captain Andrew Balbirnie’s commanding 77 at the crease.
Others: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Mohsin Naqvi met the cricket team in Dublin to boost their morale after losing the first T20I against Ireland.
Mohsin Naqvi, accompanied by Wahab Riaz from the selection committee, stressed the refusal to concede defeat against Ireland in the series opener.
Naqvi conducted an extensive two-hour session with the national team, highlighting the upcoming series against Ireland and England preceding the T20 World Cup.
Mohsin Naqvi emphasized the distinctiveness of T20 cricket, urging for an assertive demeanor on the field.
Naqvi stressed the significance of collective effort, stating that unity among the eleven players would pave Pakistan’s path to triumph.
Mohsin Naqvi concluded by urging the players to persevere until the final ball, showcasing a spirited competitive edge.
He highlighted that the ultimate challenge lies ahead in the impending World Cup, following the fixtures against Ireland and England.
